Title: Associate Director, Product Management - Data & AI Platforms
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position must be based in Toronto, Canada and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements (T/W/TH in office).
Head of Product, Data & AI
Who You Are: 
 
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. These experiences are driven by a cutting-edge set of data and machine learning, analytics, and operational systems that work in an integrated fashion to deliver a world class shopping experience for our customers. Business applications of these systems span many fields including recommendations, marketing, supply chain optimization and merchandising. These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for configurability for rapid testing and exploration. 
 
We are looking for a seasoned Product leader to join our Platforms Product team to lead a team of Product Managers working on multiple facets of our Data and AI Platforms, including real-time, batch, analytics, and also Generative AI capabilities. These platforms are leveraged by nearly all our employees for operational and analytical purposes, or for powering our AI applications geared towards internal processes and our customer and supplier experiences.
 
Were looking for someone who not only enjoys creating a bold vision, but also executing on their ideas through fruition on a global scale. In this role, you will own a range of products that will offer cloud native Data & AI capabilities to our Engineers, Analysts, and Data Scientists developing customer and supplier-focused platforms. Your goal will be to empower any team across the company with self-service software (with data or AI needs) to deploy, manage, and integrate their applications utilizing our data platforms.
 
This person will act with a high degree of freedom and ownership, setting platform vision, forming strong relationships with senior cross-functional partners (both technical and non-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This Product leader will serve as the subject matter expert, drive adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, a deep understanding of data technologies, and a proven track record of leading and developing high-performing teams.
 
What Youll Do:

Product Leadership: Develop and drive the overall strategy for our Data & AI Platforms, ensuring alignment with platforms strategy, along with delivering value for your users with in market usable solutions
AI Platforms: Set strategic direction and drive execution for Generative AI capabilities that serve a range of personas, departmental and job function needs, supporting adoption and evangelization across the organization; identify and prioritize high-value use cases, facilitate cross-functional GenAI solutions tailored to diverse personas (developers, scientists, analysts), and guide build-vs-buy decisions to maximize scalability, effectiveness, and organizational impact.
Data Platforms: Oversee the lifecycle of data platform products, including Data Movement technologies (batch and real-time), Data Lakes, Data production and consumption patterns, quality management, enabling users to self-service these capabilities on our Google Cloud environment
Team Management: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of Product Managers, creating an integrated strategy across your products, fostering a culture of collaboration, measurement and creating space to learn and improve.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and other key stakeholders to ensure our data platforms meet their needs and drive business value.
Market Analysis: Stay abreast of industry trends and competitive landscape to inform product decisions and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
Product Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data platform products and drive continuous improvement.
Driving adoption and value realization: Market your product internally to various departments to ensure all available users know about your product and how they could value from it
Communication: Articulate product vision, strategy, and roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment across the organization. Maintain a product vision and roadmap, keeping stakeholders and constituents up to date on the top level goals and timelines

 
We Are a Match Because You Have:

7+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role overseeing data platforms or similar technologies.
5+ years of product experience in developing data-driven products that are cloud native 
Strong understanding of data movement technologies (batch and real-time), Data Lakes, analytical data systems, GenAI tools and applying models to real-world problems.
Strong written and verbal communication and a demonstrated ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Proven experience in leading and collaborating with senior stakeholders along with a multi-quarter roadmap with iterative value delivery
Demonstrable ability to be technically hands-on, up to architecting high-level system plans (no coding)
Understanding of big data technologies, data lakes, streaming / real-time data solutions
Understanding of Data & AI Infrastructure tooling/solutions and scaling on public cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Ability to structure problems, develop clear hypotheses, and prioritize work against the largest impact initiatives
Experience working with multiple engineering teams, running their sprints, stand-ups, and backlog management
Cultivate senior presence and be the leader of your portfolio of products

Title: Strategy & Analytics Manager, EU
RoleDescription:
Job Description
Are you interested in helping shape the future of Wayfairs analytics and support driving insights and visibility across the business? Are you excited about being at the leading edge of Wayfairs commercial strategy, building the approach that will enable Wayfair to succeed both today and in the future?
As a Manager on the NAEURTA (North America & Europe Recipe, Tools, and Analytics) team, you will play a pivotal role in defining and executing cost, assortment and promotion strategies across Wayfair's global supplier base. Reporting to the Head of Global Recipe Performance, this individual drives measurable improvements in key cost-related metrics while enabling scalable supplier engagement and campaign execution in both the US and EU markets.
This is a highly cross-functional role, working closely with Category Management, Supplier Relationship Managers (SRMs), Profit Management, Pricing Algorithms, and Tech & Reporting teams to build tools, processes, and strategies that drive down costs, improve promotional depth, and deliver value to both Wayfair customers and suppliers.
How is this opportunity unique?
Wayfair is a data-driven environment. Candidates with experience using data to drive decision-making are great matches.
We move fast and take risks. If you loved working at a start-up or in another fast-paced, risk-taking environment, youd enjoy working at Wayfair. Be prepared to constantly evolve.
Confidence is key. The Retail Technology & Analytics team has a 360 view across suppliers, supplier-facing business teams, and internal Wayfair technology and product teams. Youll need to be able to gain buy-in from senior leaders and cross-functional teams to accomplish your goals.
Our business is in high-growth stage and so is our team. Were looking for team members who are ready and eager to get their hands dirty and drive results right away.
What You'll Do

Own and evolve Wayfairs global cost and promotional strategy, with a focus on driving competitiveness in everyday pricing and major promotional events (e.g., Way Day, Cyber Week).
Lead NA & EU-wide cost strategy and sprints , driving aggressive base cost negotiations through scalable comms, bulk recommendations, and talk tracks.
Partner with cross-functional teams and stakeholders  (Global Partner support team, Profit Management, engineering) to design and enhance tools  to support CM and supplier decision-making. (e.g Negotiation Hub, Cost Stack,etc)
Align North America and European approaches for campaigns, ensuring localization without sacrificing scalability.
Improve product cost level and drive deep promotional cost reduction for major events through supplier marketing levers, appcues, and discount strategy coordination.
Build and deliver training to Category Managers on new cost tools, negotiation strategies, and best practices.
Lead the roadmap for tech changes related to cost management, including B2B promotions, cost end date functionality, and base cost migration from superrooms.
Monitor adoption and impact of new tools and strategies, and provide ongoing reporting and feedback to senior stakeholders.

What You'll Need

Strong quantitative skills: ability to develop analytical methodologies and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, vet and pressure-test data, and synthesize findings
Strong communication skills: ability to succinctly summarize and tailor your communication style to your audience (e.g., senior business stakeholders versus technical product teams). 
Skilled in cross-functional program management, with experience working in a global or matrixed organization.
Strong problem-solving skills: ability to dissect and determine root causes, and vet / prioritize potential solutions (near- and long-term)
Strong prioritization skills: consistent nose for value, prioritizing potential projects / features based on impact to the business
Ability to learn and act quickly, making decisions and drawing conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Strategic thinker with deep experience in pricing, vendor negotiations, and promotional effectiveness.
Experience in working with complex tooling ecosystems and leading roadmap development with technical teams.
Experience managing others 
Advanced Excel and familiarity with SQL, Looker, or similar BI tools. 
5 -8  years experience in a strategy, pricing, merchandising, or consulting role.
Strong understanding of B2B/B2C retail economics and digital marketplace dynamics.

Title: Sr. Merchandising Manager, Perigold
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $149,000-161,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
The Perigold Merchandising Lead role (Sr Manager) is responsible for setting and executing on the vision of best-in-class merchandising for Perigold. They will partner closely with STO leads across Category Management, Marketing, Merchandising, Operations and Storefront to identify opportunities for merchandising optimization and utilize the team of associates, analysts and offshore resources to directly improve the Perigold merchandising experience, through e.g. scalable catalog cleanups, merchandising lever optimizations and automation, dashboard creation and alerting setup, and partnering on new go-to-market content. 
About Perigold: Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the worlds best design brands with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for your home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.
What Youll Do:

Own merchandising metrics for the PG catalog and onsite experience, including complete SKU %, assortment reporting, catalog health, merchandising productivity.
Build and execute on 12-18 month roadmap.
Identify opportunities for scalable optimization of the catalog & experience, working with direct reports and offshore resources to improve coverage metrics.
Partner closely with merchandising teams on nuanced merchandising needed by customer type, category or platform.
Manage a team of 5 associates and analysts, identifying opportunities for team development throughout the roadmap and promoting collaboration within the team.
Manage offshore resources and optimize workflows to get optimal benefit from cost.
Work cross-functionally with category management and marketing to solve Perigold-wide problems, including collaborating on assortment optimization, go-to-market content, site navigation and supplier management.
Build out business reporting needs and prioritize within the Merchandising analytics community.

What Youll Need:

Strong analytical orientation, capable of leveraging data to dissect complex problems, formulate testable hypotheses, rigorously verify those hypotheses through data analysis, and ultimately develop and implement well-supported recommendations.
A keen eye for premium product presentation, understanding the nuances of visual merchandising and branding that elevate the perceived value of products.
Senior presence coupled with strong communication skills, capable of articulating ideas clearly and persuasively. 
Exceptional stakeholder management skills, adept at building and maintaining positive relationships across teams and levels, effectively managing expectations, and driving collaborative outcomes.
Bachelors Degree.

Title: Sr. Manager, B2B Paid Digital Marketing
RoleDescription:
Senior Manager, Digital Marketing  Wayfair Professional
Wayfair Professional, the B2B arm of Wayfair.com, is looking for a strategic and innovative Senior Manager to serve as our Head of Digital Marketing. This individual will own the strategy, execution, and optimization of all paid digital marketing channels across the Wayfair Professional customer lifecycle, with a focus on delivering seamless and interconnected customer experiences that drive both acquisition and retention.
In this high-impact role, you will manage $40M+ in annual ad spend, mentor and develop a team of four digital marketing analysts and collaborate cross-functionally with our Account Based Marketing, Sales, Customer Communications, Creative, Internal Prospecting and Brand teams. Your work will play a pivotal role in bringing our Account Based Marketing (ABM) efforts to life and driving meaningful business outcomes through data-driven and customer-first marketing strategies through an intense focus on lead generation and opportunity pipeline progression.
What Youll Do

Own end-to-end strategy, planning, and execution of all paid digital marketing initiatives for Wayfair Professional, including:

Paid Search (PLA, SEM, ToF Search, Paid Brand)
Display Advertising
Paid Social
Emerging platforms such as LinkedIn, Pinterest, and other ABM-relevant channels

Lead and mentor a team of four analysts, fostering a high-performance, test-and-learn culture rooted in data, experimentation, and iteration
Leverage analytics to track campaign performance, identify trends and opportunities, and optimize for business impact both through the efforts of your team and through individual analysis and contributions as required to maximize business performance.
Partner closely with our Account Based Marketing team and Sales to align digital marketing strategies with customer segmentation and ABM goals
Collaborate with the Creative, Customer Communications, and Brand teams to deliver cohesive messaging across touchpoints, ensuring an integrated experience from first impression through long-term retention
Manage budgets, forecast performance, and allocate spend across channels to maximize ROI
Stay ahead of industry trends and evaluate emerging channels and technologies to drive innovation within the B2B marketing space

What Youll Need

5+ years of experience in digital marketing, with demonstrated expertise across paid channels; B2B marketing experience is preferred.
Exceptional problem-solving skills, analytical rigor, partnered with insatiable curiosity and obsession over the details will make you successful in this role
Passion for the customer and a drive to build best-in-class experiences across the buyer journey
Proven success in managing and scaling high-performing marketing teams
Strong understanding of performance marketing metrics, customer segmentation, and lifecycle marketing
Experience working cross-functionally with Sales, Creative, and Brand organizations, ideally in a fast-paced or high-growth environment
Experience with marketing platforms including Google Ads, Meta Ads, LinkedIn Ads, DSPs, and analytics tools
Familiarity with Account Based Marketing approaches and associated tools is a strong plus

Title: Signage Print Production Coordinator
RoleDescription:
This is a full-time position (40 hours/week) based in our Boston office. Attendance in-office is required Monday - Thursday, Friday is WFH optional. 
 
Who We Are: 
The Wayfair Visual Merchandising  team is a multi-talented group of strategic and innovative thinkers across many disciplines, partnering closely with cross functional  leaders to catapult Wayfair into the leading destination for all things home by developing engaging advertising campaigns, next-in-class consumer experiences, and scalable brand systems.
 
Job Description:
Wayfair is seeking an experienced Signage Print Production Coordinator to join our team. The role will contribute to all aspects of the end to end creative development and production process supporting our Wayfair physical retail operations. This role includes many of the traditional aspects of experiential and event production, including interacting with  a stable of external fabricators, juggling tight timelines, balancing budgets, and coordinating with field employees on delivery and installation. The Signage Print Production Coordinator must collaborate and partner closely with our creative, marketing and Physical Retail teams.
The ideal candidate will have a track record of success in retail print production or similar production, project management or production operations, and will demonstrate an ability to confidently manage a process and influence diverse teams to meet deadlines and collaborate toward a common goal. A strong operational orientation is key to success in this role, as is a keen eye for efficiency and a passion for process improvement. 
Physical Retail is a new and growing team at Wayfair, so the Signage Print Production Coordinator will need to collaborate with all partner teams, championing the process up front, rolling it out across the teams, and continuing to optimize and pivot as we grow and scale. It will require flexibility and a scrappy, roll up the sleeves mentality to build out this new capability from the ground up. Youll coordinate and deliver projects that support our existing stores seasonal floor sets in addition to projects that support Wayfairs scaling expansion in Physical Retail. This role will focus on Wayfair and their Standalone Brands (SAB): AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main and Perigold.
 
What You'll Do: 
Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders including: Visual Presentation, Brand Creative, Creative Operations, Marketing and Store Operations
Facilitate excellent print production management as it relates to: time, cost and communication, ensuring vendor output matches Wayfairs quality and service expectations
Prioritize and complete multiple projects within competing deadlines with high level of organizational skills
Review project financials: purchasing, billing and reconciliation; escalating budget risks in a timely and efficient manner.
Maintain and update the vendor/supplier database and department budget (specific to visual creative services) and support execution and submission of purchase orders, invoices, etc.
Monitor delivery and implementation of projects with Installation Manager within our Mock Store Locations or Physical Retail stores. 
Maintain and update communications to store teams accurately and adjust as needed.
Support New Store Openings with launch kits and supplies.
Project types such as: in-store presentation displays, decorative props, non-branded and branded elements and supplies are within the scope of this role.

What You'll Need:
Communication is key and you should be comfortable working in a fast-paced technology and data-driven business environment.
We are looking for individuals who have a proven track record in owning and driving major businesses/initiatives, managing teams and developing functions in environments such as: 

Print and Signage production - including paper, cardstock, vinyl and dye sub
Project Management 
Retail - Big Box / Specialty
Seasoned Retail Associate, with exposure to production experience
Exposure to vendor management process

Wayfair is a leader in the e-commerce space for all things home. We live and breathe modern technologies. Were looking for smart, logical thinkers who can advocate for systems and designs that work at scale, but still retain the startup feel. We pride ourselves on scrappy innovation - getting real, working solutions deployed quickly and iterating based on data.
Our Site Reliability Engineering team is looking for experienced engineers who have a mind for cloud native design, stability, and an understanding of SRE best practices - and some ideas about what could be better! We work across our Technology organization to ensure our platforms and services are ready for prime time by contributing to both the platform and software code bases.

Title: Senior Specialist, Retail Logistics Operations
RoleDescription:
Sr. Specialist, Retail Inventory & Logistics Ops
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Compensation: $21 per hour is the starting pay rate for this position.
Overview:
As a Senior Specialist of Inventory & Logistics, youll play a critical role in driving operational excellence and ensuring seamless inventory and supply chain processes within Wayfairs Physical Retail store in Wilmette. Reporting to the Department Manager, youll lead key initiatives that optimize inventory accuracy, streamline logistics operations, and enhance overall store efficiency. Leveraging data-driven insights and problem-solving expertise, youll implement best practices that improve product availability, minimize discrepancies, and support a flawless customer shopping experience.
In this role, youll also mentor Logistics & Inventory Specialists, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and take ownership of projects that enhance store performance. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment, and has a strong background in inventory management and logistics, and is passionate about building scalable solutions that drive retail success.
What Does a Sr. Specialist of Inventory & Logistics Do?

Demonstrate Reliability & Professionalism: Maintain strong attendance and communication to support business needs. Proactively address scheduling or operational challenges to ensure consistent store coverage.
Lead Inventory Control & Accuracy: Own the Cycle Count Program and other inventory control initiatives to ensure accurate stock levels, minimize shrinkage, and optimize inventory flow. Analyze data trends to forecast demand and adjust inventory strategies accordingly.
Optimize Logistics & Supply Chain Operations: Evaluate and refine logistics processes to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve fulfillment speed. Implement best practices for shipment processing, stock replenishment, and overall supply chain coordination.
Oversee Shipment Processing & Vendor Coordination: Manage inbound and outbound shipments, ensuring accurate receiving, processing, and dispatch. Partner with vendors and distribution teams to resolve fulfillment discrepancies and improve delivery timelines.
Drive Operational Excellence & Compliance: Monitor adherence to inventory and logistics policies, conduct regular audits, and implement corrective actions to maintain high operational standards.
Mentor & Develop Logistics Team Members: Train and support Logistics & Inventory Specialists, providing guidance on best practices, troubleshooting challenges, and fostering a high-performance culture.
Analyze Performance & Drive Data-Driven Decisions: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory, shipping, and logistics. Leverage insights to identify areas for improvement and make informed recommendations.
Ensure Cross-Functional Alignment: Collaborate with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams to integrate logistics processes with broader business objectives. Provide insights to improve product availability and customer experience.
Solve Problems & Lead Continuous Improvement: Identify operational bottlenecks and implement innovative solutions to enhance workflow, accuracy, and efficiency in logistics operations.
Adapt to Rapid Change & Evolving Business Needs: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by staying agile, managing shifting priorities, and proactively addressing challenges as they arise.

What are the Job Requirements?

Education: Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field preferred, or equivalent work experience.
Experience: 3-5 years of experience in inventory control, logistics, or supply chain operations, preferably in a retail environment. Experience leading projects, mentoring team members, and driving operational improvements.
Inventory & Logistics Expertise: Strong understanding of inventory management principles, logistics workflows, and best practices for stock accuracy and shipment processing. Experience with WMS systems and inventory tracking technology is a plus.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and develop effective solutions to improve efficiency, accuracy, and cost-effectiveness.
Leadership & Collaboration: Proven ability to mentor, train, and develop team members while working cross-functionally with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel) or Google Suite (especially Sheets). Familiarity with inventory management systems, order management tools, and scan technology preferred.
Physical Requirements: Ability to perform frequent movement, including standing, kneeling, crouching, and repetitive motions. Must be able to lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs as needed.
Availability: Open schedule availability, including nights, weekends, and holidays, is required.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

Physical Demands

Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance

Working Environment

Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
Occasional noise and vibrations
Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation (starting at $21/hour) with regular opportunities for performance-based increases.

 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.

Title: Product Designer II
RoleDescription:
This is a hybrid-onsite role. Employees are expected to be in our Boston, MA office Tuesdays-Thursday, and work remotely Mondays and Fridays. 
Who We Are
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.
As a Product Designer II, you will be directly impacting the home shopping journeymaking it easy for Wayfair customers to bring their home vision to life. Youll be asked to flex into key customer experiences within the shopping funnel such as Wayfairs product listing, product details pages while thinking holistically across the entire shopping funnel.   
What Youll Do:

Utilize design thinking principles to build engaging customer experiences which solve goals with elegant simplicity.
Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other experienced designers to execute design concepts that deliver on brand goals, business goals, and are technically feasible to implement.
Align with multiple teams to create cross-functional and user-centric design solutions.
Drive a sense of urgency in the team to deliver work, emphasizing the use of lean tools and techniques to more rapidly deliver work.
Day-to-day work will consist of a combination of design execution, and design operations management.
Contribute to the improvement of our cross-team collaboration Design processes, advocating best practices and innovative solutions between Product, Design, and Engineering teams embracing Agile methodologies.
Demonstrate strong administration and communication skills. Be a strategist who can take a step back on overarching goals and opportunities, while also acting as a product practitioner who can meticulously work alongside their teams with domain knowledge and design prowess.

 
We Are a Match Because You Have:

3+ years of professional UX experience.
The ability to deliver high-fidelity design work autonomously.
Strong understanding of design processes; knowledge of what is possible and what will be hard to achieve and/or implement in a digital environment.
Communication and Interpersonal Skills: You should be able to effectively present and explain ideas, while also being open-minded and willing to consider new perspectives that may shape your solutions.
Problem-solving & Critical thinking: Framing design challenges and generating solutions based on user needs and business goals.
Visual & interaction design: Understanding of layout, typography, spacing, and creating a strong visual hierarchy. Ability to design intuitive and user-friendly interfaces.
User research: You have a solid understanding of basic research principles and methodologies, and have a proven track record of independently conducting user research while selecting appropriate methodologies to inform your design.
Expertise in producing relevant deliverables, including detailed site maps, user flows/task flows, user journeys,, high-fidelity UI mocks, annotations, and prototypes that represent interaction recommendations, etc.
An online portfolio of case studies that demonstrates unfailing advocacy for the user, highlighting: e-commerce design work, enterprise design work, data-driven approaches, and strategic thinking.

Title: Operations Industrial Engineer
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Final Mile Centers in Norton, MA or Linden, NJ. 
The Operations Industrial Engineer plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

We are building Sponsored Products, Display & Video Ad offerings that cater to a variety of Advertiser goals while showing highly relevant and engaging Ads to millions of customers. We are evolving our Ads Platform to empower advertisers across all sophistication levels to grow their business on Wayfair at a strong, positive ROI and are leveraging state of the art Machine Learning techniques.

Intellectual curiosity and enthusiastic about continuous learning

Title: Talent Business Partner, Technology
RoleDescription:
This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday- Thursday, with remote flexibility on Fridays.
Our Tech Talent team is the strategic arm of Wayfairs People function. We activate business strategy through our greatest assetour peopleby designing, implementing, and scaling programs that attract, grow, and retain top technical talent. Who you are: 

Strategic Operator: Owns and executes a holistic people strategy that aligns to business goals, using the right mix of org design, workforce planning, and talent levers to drive impact.
Detailed Problem Solver: Thrives in ambiguity, demonstrates high attention to detail and anticipates second- and third-order effects across functions/geographies to deliver scalable, people-centric solutions.
High Judgement Trusted Advisor: Acts as a thought partner to senior leaders (Director-level) with exceptional judgment in navigating sensitive, nuanced, and confidential scenarios.
Data-Driven Influencer: Builds hypotheses, dives deep into data, and delivers insights that inspire and empower business leaders to take informed action.
Exceptional Communicator: Synthesizes diverse stakeholder perspectives into clear, actionable plans; communicates with clarity, confidence, and empathy across all levels.

Curious Business Athlete: Deeply curious about the business, always seeking to raise the bar and connect talent strategy to long-term company growth.

Architect Scalable Talent Solutions:  Collaborate cross-functionally to build and execute org and talent strategiescovering workforce planning, org design, succession, and change managementthat address the complexity and pace of a global, matrixed tech environment.

Advanced degree or HR certification (PHR, SHRMCP/SCP, CHRL)

Title: Part Time Engineer, Help Bar
RoleDescription:
This is a part-time position requiring 20 to 30 hours of work per week.
 
Who We Are [Help Bar]
At Wayfair, our Technical Support Engineers are the first line of defense in ensuring our corporate teams can work effectively and efficiently. Based at our corporate Help Bar, you'll provide in-person, walk-up technical support to Wayfair employees, handling a wide range of requests and issuessoftware, hardware, applications, system access, and more. Youll be a trusted resource, a tech-savvy problem solver, and a friendly face in the office.
 
This is more than just an IT support role  its an opportunity to learn, grow, and become an integral part of a tech-driven organization. In this position, youll work alongside infrastructure and software engineering teams, gaining firsthand experience with the tools, systems, and architecture that power a $2B+ company. What makes this role truly special is its focus on growth and development; managers and teammates are genuinely invested in helping you succeed. Great performance is recognized and rewarded, and youll have the chance to handle a variety of issues across infrastructure and software, offering valuable cross-functional exposure. Flexibility and the ability to pivot quickly in a fast-paced environment

 As the IT Service Desk Manager, you will face an array of responsibilities and challenges, including:

Manage and motivate a team of 5 to 8 tier 1 and tier 2 Bengaluru based IT Support Technicians, who handle various channels of communication such as incident tickets, phone calls, chats, walk-up support, and emails from Wayfair employees seeking technical assistance.
